talk_paragraph.talk_question: <html>{ui_string:1200001}</html>
<html>{ui_string:1200002}</html>
<html>{ui_string:1200003}</html>
<html>{ui_string:1200004}</html>
<html>{ui_string:1200005}</html>
<html>{ui_string:257}</html>

$Princess Sylvania$
You don't have to escort me. I'll take care of myself, so don't worry. Let's just get going.

$Princess Sylvania$
(The Princess is facing Maisa.)

$Manager Maisa$
{user_nick}? And…. the Princess. What brings you two together?
(Looks at {user_nick}.) Are you here to get a mission? (Turns to the Princess) Or to give one?

${user_nick}$
The matter at hand has more to do with her than me… (Indicates the Princess.)

$Manager Maisa$
Princess? Whatever could this be about? Do you need a security detail?
The atmosphere in Rhadames is a bit unsettling at the moment, isn't it?

$Princess Sylvania$
I don't need an escort. That's just a hassle.
Anyway you are... Well, that's not important. There's only one thing I need to do now.

$Princess Sylvania$
I came to meet my nanny!
So, (whispers)... Understood? Please tell us where we can find her!

${user_nick}$
(Why is she being so secretive? She must have mentioned a name...)

$Manager Maisa$
...?! Wh-, what?! How do you know that name, Princess?!

$Princess Sylvania$
How? I told you, she was my nanny! Is there any more explanation required?
Don't tell me... Either you didn't know she was a nanny once or you don't know who I am.

$Manager Maisa$
The Grand Master used to be... well that doesn't matter.
But there's no way you'd think she was a nanny by looking at her… (Stares at the Princess.)

$Manager Maisa$
Princess…? You were that immature young lady?? So that brat wasn't just any noble, she was you????

$Princess Sylvania$
Immature!? Brat!? I was just a child!!

$Manager Maisa$
That's just it!!

${user_nick}$
Hang on! Back it up! Let's talk so that all three of us can understand.
Who is this Grand Master you're talking about?

$Princess Sylvania$
Did I not tell you? She was my nanny a long time ago.
I think...? It's my first time hearing her referred to as the Grand Master, though.

${user_nick}$
Nanny? You mean the person you mentioned who founded the militia?

${user_nick}$
I don't have any clue where you might find her, but... Wait. Did you refer to her as the Grand Master, Maisa?
(This place is getting more interesting by the day.)

$Manager Maisa$
Just what makes you think…?
How could you be so shameless? Do you really think the Grand Master will meet with you, Princess?

$Princess Sylvania$
Just tell her I did something bad.
And say I want to meet her. That she be enough, right?

$Manager Maisa$
You know why the Grand Master left Aergal in the first place!
Why would she meet with you when she detests you so?!

$Princess Sylvania${sound:npc_Sylviana_qu9956_sp_01.ogg}
D-... detests me or not... You're honestly saying she won't come?
No matter what she thinks, I'm still the Princess of Aergal!

$Manager Maisa$
And that's the place she hates most: Aergal.
There's no way she'll come!

$Princess Sylvania${sound:npc_Sylviana_qu9956_sp_02.ogg}
Then… (Pauses momentarily.)
Then, tell her I'm a pitiful wretch who was robbed of all her possessions, and that she should come see what a sorry sight I am!

${user_nick}$
(Who would want to come see another ruined?)

$Manager Maisa$
Why are you being so forceful?
If you just had a mission to see to, you could have had it carried out through me. So why do you want to see the Grand Master so much?

$Princess Sylvania$
It's because it's not just a simple mission. We need her militia to help protect Rhadames.
There's no way I could delegate such an important task to a manager.

$Manager Maisa$
... For Rhadames, you say… Well, if you get rejected, don't blame me.
Got it? (Starts to call someone.)

$Princess Sylvania$
I doubt she'll turn down an opportunity to see me in such a sorry state.

$Manager Maisa$
Anyway, go to Merca's Port. That's where you'll find her.
※ Meet with members of MHN in Merca's Port.

$Grand Master$
So, it's you. Long time no see, Princess. When I heard you wanted to come see me
with your tail between your legs, I wasn't sure what sorry state you'd be in. I'm relieved to see you look fine.

$Princess Sylvania$
Hahaha. I don't think that's a compliment, but I'll try not to take it too harshly. Everything you said turned out to be true.
Anyway, you sure look healthy. I heard that you started a militia, so I guess you're doing well.

$Grand Master$
I'm getting by. Far better than when I was with you.

$Princess Sylvania$
(Starts to say something, but holds back.) That's a relief. Did you hear about Aergal?
I want to borrow your strength to help resolve the situation.

$Grand Master$
I happened to hear about Aergal. It was destroyed in a Child attack, right?
I knew it wouldn't last, but didn't think that was how it would go down.

$Princess Sylvania$
Somehow.... Wait, what are you talking about?
It sounds like you were expecting Aergal to fall!

$Grand Master$
I'm glad to see you're mature enough to understand what you are told now.
What a relief. As your nanny, I'm proud of how you've grown.

$Princess Sylvania$
How could you say that?! Aergal was your home too!

$Grand Master$
Home? I wasn't even born there. Rather, Aergal was a source of contempt for me.
Why do you think I left? I guess you thought I just took off for no reason.

$Grand Master${sound:npc_Laoshi_qu9956_sp_01.ogg}
But enough of that... (The Grand Master looks over at {user_nick}.) You're {user_nick}.
It's a pleasure to meet you. I'm the leader of MHN. You can call me Grand Master.

${user_nick}$
Huh? Wait, the leader of MHN?! Didn't you say you were a nanny earlier?
(I better get the full story from the Princess.)

${user_nick}$
Princess, what is this about?
Am I to believe that… your nanny... is the leader of MHN?!

$Princess Sylvania$
MHN? I'm... not familiar with that name. Haha.
I might have heard it once while traveling to the Western Territory.
Anyway, it is true that my nanny established a militia. This is it. Does this mean it's famous?

${user_nick}$
Not just famous. Gaining the support of MHN would be liking having the deck stacked in your favor…
What are you going to do?
Let me just tell you in advance that mercenaries act for money or some other profit, not for compassion.

$Princess Sylvania$
You think I don't know that much?!

${user_nick}$
Then how are you going to get them to join the fight? Do you have a plan?
(Is this why she brought me along? That Norfe, he knew the whole time, didn't he?
What a devious old man.)

$Princess Sylvania$
Of course! ...I mean, that's something we have to put our heads together about, isn't it?
Hahaha. Surely you won't ignore a person who asks for help... Right…?

${user_nick}$
(Ugh, she totally brought me here without any plan whatsoever...

$Grand Master$
So you came here for the sake of Rhadames, Princess.
Well, you must have attracted a lot of attention, so you'll be needing more military capacity.

${user_nick}$
Eeek! (Did she here us talking?)

$Princess Sylvania$
Well... we were going to tell her anyway, so what does it matter?
That's right, Nanny, we came here-… M..HN was it...? Anyway, we came here seeking your swords for Rhadames.
Surely... you'll agree... to help...? Right?

$Grand Master$
You want to make use of MHN's swords…
I'm assuming you think Rhadames is the next target of the Childs now that Aergal is out of the picture?

$Grand Master${sound:npc_Laoshi_qu9956_sp_02.ogg}
In that case it's very simple. Rhadames must send MHN an official job offer.
That way our mercenaries can take up the mission as they please.
Of course, the more that show up, the more you'll have to pay.

$Princess Sylvania$
I think you misunderstood. We don't want to hire you, we want you to join forces with us.
Do you think Rhadames has that kind of money?! Are you not aware of the situation there?

$Grand Master$
Of course I am. But when you say "join forces" it sounds like you mean "work for free"…
Do you honestly expect mercenaries to agree to such terms?
You really must not understand how this business works.

${user_nick}$
(Nods) I tried to tell her.
Mercenaries act for money or other gains, not for compassion.

$Princess Sylvania${sound:npc_Sylviana_qu9956_sp_03.ogg}
But… Isn't it natural to assume they'd want to protect Rhadames?
Rhadames is a haven from the Childs. There's no reason not to help.

${user_nick}$
It's not natural. Especially since there's no money in it, right?
A few of the mercenaries might be moved to help as you have said, but to expect MHN to join in as a whole...

$Grand Master${sound:npc_Laoshi_qu9956_sp_03.ogg}
(Nods.) Right, MHN has no reason to assist Rhadames without some reward.
And if the reason we should help Rhadames is to maintain a safe haven from the Childs...
Do you think mercenaries need something like that?

$Grand Master$
The only answer is no. They're too busy to do such a thing. There are a lot of profitable missions these days.
The existence of Rhadames has never been relevant to MHN from the start.

$Grand Master$
Besides, since when were you ever interested in Rhadames, Princess?
I find it hard to believe someone like you
who only ever cared about herself really intends to help Rhadames.

$Grand Master${sound:npc_Laoshi_qu9956_sp_04.ogg}
Only after Aergal became beholden to Rhadames do you ask me to lend a helping hand.
It seems you are really asking MHN to help Aergal, not Rhadames. Am I wrong?

$Princess Sylvania$
What do you mean, I only care about myself? When did I say that?
And to rebuild Aergal... No! I speak solely for Rhadames!
Of course, I'd appreciate it if you could help me rebuild Aergal later, but... (Mutters to herself.)

$Grand Master$
You were always like that.
Even now, You can't say this isn't for Aergal.
I guess you don't remember what happened in the past, so shall we take this opportunity to reflect on it, incident by incident?

$Grand Master$
It might have been... when you were about 5 years old. You said you were curious about the greenhouse in the palace,
so you went for a walk inside and suddenly said you wanted to decorate your room with flowers.
Not with artificial flowers, but real flowers.

$Grand Master$
Due to the nature of Aergal as an underground city, it was neither easy nor cheap to grow real flowers.
So when I explained that it was impossible, what did you do?

$Princess Sylvania$
Well, maybe I... Haha. I don't really remember.

$Grand Master$
Okay, I'll be happy to jog your memory. Saying, "But there are already flowers here,"
you snatched them all from the greenhouse and filled your room with them.
Thanks to you, the greenhouse was closed until the next flowering season.

${user_nick}$
(Goodness...)

$Grand Master$
There were precious herbs housed there, so you caused quite a fuss for some time...
But no one blamed you. Why? Because you were the high and mighty Princess who was loved by the kingdom.

$Princess Sylvania$
I-... I was so young back then...! Surely there's nothing wrong with a child loving flowers?!
And the herbs…. I remember the matter being resolved somehow!

$Grand Master$
I knew you'd say that. As you said, they managed to solve the issue somehow.
It was because Aergal, using their mastery of technology, managed to improve the strains of herbs.
Thanks to this mastery, there were even rumors of a Herb of Immortality for a while.

$Grand Master$
Well, enough of that story. Shall we talk about when you were eight years old? It was the day before your birthday.
You said you didn't like the color of the dress you were wearing for the banquet and asked me to make it white.

$Grand Master$
The dress was especially made for your birthday.
Even worse, it was a material that couldn't be stained, so there was no way to change its color.
But when I got you another dress, you said you didn't like it.

$Grand Master$
You insisted that you wanted to wear a white dress
and eventually painted the dress with white paint.
Of all things, it had to be oil paint that you used.

${user_nick}$
(What an immature child she was.)

$Grand Master$
Eventually, the dress was ruined, and the Princess had a temper tantrum.
But who do you think suffered for it? You don't think it was the Princess who had to pay for it, do you?

$Princess Sylvania$
Is that... so? Haha. Even still, I seem to recall everything working out in the end...?

$Grand Master$
I had to seam a new dress for your birthday. This time you wanted it to be red.
Thanks to you, Aergal's dyeing ability advanced to a new level.

$Grand Master$
That autumn you said you wanted to draw pictures and scribbled on the portraits in the gallery honoring the kingdom's great princes...

$Princess Sylvania$
S-, stop! Enough!!!

${user_nick}$
I can't believe you were so...

$Princess Sylvania$
You yourself said it was before I had matured, right? And now I'm a completely different person!

$Grand Master$
You weren't immature, you just hated listening to what anyone else said and only thought of yourself.
Just like all the people of Aergal.

$Grand Master$
If only the Princess was the problem, I could have simply quit my job.
But this was the way all Aergals thought: solely for themselves.

$Grand Master$
Why do you think Aergal locked itself away and hid from the world?
Do you know, {user_nick}?

${user_nick}$
Huh? Well... I always assumed it was for security reasons.

$Grand Master$
Right, that would naturally be the case. But Aergal locked itself away for a different reason.
It was to avoid leaking their own technology to others.
So that only they could use their technology.

$Grand Master$
You must not have ever heard of the ability to grow flowers underground, the herb known as the Herb of Immortality,
or clothes that could never be stained.
That makes sense. They locked themselves away to make sure others would never learn of or posses their technology.

$Grand Master${sound:npc_Laoshi_qu9956_sp_05.ogg}
Are you confident that you've changed? I don't know...
How much can a person really change anyway? I don't think a Princess
who has lived in Aergal can abandon that Aergalian mindset.
<html>$Quest Reward$</html>

journal.title: Princess' Nanny
journal.contents:
Believe it or not, the former nanny of the Princess apparently established a militia. First thing's first, you should follow the Princess and go to Maisa to hear if they will join forces with Rhadames.

Rhadames - Manager Maisa
journal.destination: (Solo) Speak with Manager Maisa in Rhadames

journal.title: Recruiting MHN
journal.contents:
Just who is this nanny to tell Maisa whether or not she will meet with the Princess? It must not be any ordinary militia if even MHN needs to tiptoe around her. Head to Merca's Port for now and meet the members of MHN.

Merca's Port - Grand Master
journal.destination: (Solo) Speak with the Grand Master in Merca's Port

journal.title: The Nanny's Identity
journal.contents:
The Princess' nanny turned out to be the head of MHN! How could that be? A nanny from Aergal founded MHN? You better hear the details from the Princess.

Merca's Port - Princess Sylvania
journal.destination: (Solo) Speak with Princess Sylvania at Merca's Port

journal.title: Immature Princess
journal.contents:
Given Rhadames' situation, it would be nice if the head of MHN helped Rhadames. For that to happen, it is necessary to persuade the Grand Master, but the Princess's attitude is strange. She's acting like she's been put on the defensive. For now, talk to the Grand Master to see if she is willing to help Rhadames.

Merca's Port - Grand Master
journal.destination: (Solo) Speak with the Grand Master in Merca's Port
